channel.title: CVE Feed for MainWP -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for MainWP -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-23737|2024-09-18T16:32:29.195Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20broken%20links%20checker%20extension
item.description: Unauth. SQL Injection (SQLi) vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Broken Links Checker Extension plugin <= 4.0 versions.

item.title: CVE-2023-23651|2024-09-18T16:29:45.246Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20google%20analytics%20extension
item.description: Auth. (subscriber+) SQL Injection (SQLi) vulnerability in MainWP Google Analytics Extension plugin <= 4.0.4 versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-7492|2024-08-08T15:28:04.017Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20child%20reports
item.description: The MainWP Child Reports plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the network_options_action() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update arbitrary options that can be leveraged for privilege escalation via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link. This is only exploitable on multisite instances.

item.title: CVE-2023-23656|2024-08-07T17:56:13.274Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20file%20uploader%20extension
item.description: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type vulnerability in MainWP MainWP File Uploader Extension.This issue affects MainWP File Uploader Extension: from n/a through 4.1.

item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Child Reports.This issue affects MainWP Child Reports: from n/a through 2.1.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-7492|2024-08-08T02:32:08.923Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20child%20reports
item.description: The MainWP Child Reports plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the network_options_action() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update arbitrary options that can be leveraged for privilege escalation via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link. This is only exploitable on multisite instances.
